THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE MASSACHUSETTS  MA  DEPARTMENT OFTRANSPORTATION, REGISTRY OF MOTOR VEHICLES TO INCREASE OVERSIGHT AND MONITORING OF THE MA SKILLS TEST EXAMINER UNIT BY HIRING AN ANALYST TO ANALYZE THE SKILLS TESTING DATA  HIRE ANELECTRONIC DATA PROCESSING SYSTEMS ANALYST TO OVERSEE BOTH THE STATE POINTER EXCHANGE SERVICES  SPEXS  UNIT AND THE OUT OF STATE NOTIFICATION UNIT TO IDENTIFY AND FIX THE ROOT CAUSE ISSUES IDENTIFIED IN THE CD31 REPORTS AND RUN THEM MORE FREQUENTLY

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE MINNESOTA DRIVER AND VEHICLE SERVICES TO SUPPORT THE TRAINING COSTS TO TRANSITION TO THE MODERNIZED AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF MOTOR VEHICLE ADMINISTRATOR S  AAMVA  CDL SKILLS TESTING MODEL UPON APPROVAL  IMPLEMENT SOFTWARE THAT WILL ALLOW THIRD PARTY PROCTORS TO ADMINISTER THE CDL KNOWLEDGE TESTS AND AUTOMATICALLY TRANSMIT RESULTS TO THE MINNESOTA DRIVER DATABASE  MNDRIVE  AND PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR 4 YEARS OF OPERATIONS  PROCURE 210 RUGGED EXTREME TABLETS TO ENABLE EXAMINERS TO TRANSMIT RESULTS SECURELY TO MNDRIVE UPON COMPLETION OF TESTS BY ALL STATE AND THIRD PARTY EXAMINERS

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE NATIONAL JUDICIAL COLLEGE TO DELIVERTECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, OUTREACH, AND GUIDANCE TO TRIBAL COURTS ON REPORTING CDL VIOLATIONS ENFORCED AND ADJUDICATED ON TRIBAL LANDS TO STATE DRIVER LICENSING AGENCIES  SDLAS   CREATE A CDL SELF STUDY COURSE FOR JUDGES  CONDUCT RESEARCH ON THE IMPACT OF JUDICIAL EDUCATION TO IMPROVE CDL COURSES AND MATERIAL AVAILABLE TO THE JUDICIARY ON REDUCING MASKING OFFENSES DURING ADJUDICATION OF CDL HOLDERS  CITATIONS AND RESEARCH TO DEVELOP BEST PRACTICES FORJUDICIARY HANDLING CDL CMV ADJUDICATION

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD TO THE ALABAMA LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY  ALEA  IS TO PROVIDEFUNDING TO PROCESS MEDICAL EXAMINER S CERTIFICATES AND OUT OF STATE CONVICTIONS  REDUCE THE WAIT TIME FOR COMMERCIAL DRIVER S LICENSE  CDL  SKILLS TESTING  PROVIDE REQUIRED RECURRENT TRAINING TO STATE AND THIRD PARTY EXAMINERS  PRINT CDL STUDY MANUALS FOR POTENTIAL DRIVERS  AND CONDUCT COVERT AND OVERT SKILLS TESTING AUDITS ON ALL STATE AND THIRD PARTY EXAMINERS

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE SOUTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR VEHICLES TO HIRE A TEMPORARY ATTORNEY TO PROSECUTE CDL AND COMMERCIAL LICENSE PERMIT  CLP  HOLDERS FOR REFUSING TO TEST FOR DRIVING UNDER THE INFLUENCE  PROVIDE OUTREACH AND TRAINING TO PERSONNEL ASSOCIATED WITH ADJUDICATING THESE TYPES OF CASES  INCREASE NUMBER OF CDL TESTS BY 80 PERCENT  216  PER YEAR BY CONDUCTING MASS TESTING AT FOUR LOCATIONS FOR FOUR YEARS  HIRE TWO TEMPORARY EMPLOYEES TO ANALYZE DATA TO DETERMINE IF CDL AND CLPS ARE BEING ACQUIRED FRAUDULENTLY  AND INCREASE THE NUMBER OF TRAINING EXAMINERS TO TRAIN NEW EXAMINERS AND RECERTIFY EXISTING STATE AND THIRD PARTY EXAMINERS

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE IOWA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION TO IMPROVE CDL DATA REPORTING TO CLOSE ANNUAL PROGRAM REVIEW FINDINGS  INCREASE THIRD PARTY AUDITING ACTIVITIES  REDUCE TESTING DELAYS BY HIRING AND TRAINING ADDITIONAL PERSONNEL  AND EXPANDING HOURS FOR CDL TESTING AND ISSUANCES FOR 2 YEARS

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE NATIONAL DISTRICT ATTORNEYS ASSOCIATION TO STRENGTHEN THE NATIONAL CDL PROGRAM BY INCREASING THE AWARENESS OF PROSECUTORS AND OTHER CDL STAKEHOLDERS ABOUT THE  ONE DRIVER, ONE LICENSE, ONE RECORD CONCEPT THROUGH TRAINING, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AND RESOURCES ON THE PROHIBITION OF MASKING AND THE IMPLICATIONS OF DISQUALIFICATIONS, INCLUDING HUMAN TRAFFICKING AND OTHER FELONY CONVICTIONS

THE PURPOSE OFTHIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA, DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR VEHICLES TO MINIMIZE THE NUMBER OF INAPPROPRIATELY ADMINISTERED CDL SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE EXAMINATIONS  THE NUMBER OF OPERATORS WHO WILL NEED TO BE RETESTED BY THE DEPARTMENT  AND ENSURE PROPER TRAINING OF COMMERCIAL MOTOR VEHICLE OPERATORS IN THE COMMONWEALTH

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE WASHINGTON STATE DEPARTMENT OF LICENSING IS TO HIRE FOUR ADDITIONAL COMMERCIAL DRIVER S LICENSE  CDL  SKILLS TEST EXAMINERS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF TESTS BY 26 PERCENT WHICH IS PROJECTED TO INCREASE TESTING CAPACITY

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR STATE COURTS TO ENHANCE COURT EXPERTISE BY IMPLEMENTING PROCESS IMPROVEMENTS TO ADJUDICATE CDL CASES THROUGH AN ASSESSMENT OF ON LINE DISPUTE RESOLUTION  ODR  PRACTICES, DEVELOPING TECHNOLOGY STANDARDS AND POLICY GUIDANCE  DEVELOPING A HYBRID HEARING TECHNOLOGY AND POLICY GUIDANCE PROVIDING OUTREACH, EDUCATION AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ON ODR DEVELOPMENTS  AND DEVELOPING A HUMAN TRAFFICKING E LEARNING COURSE THAT THE VARIOUS COURTS CAN PROVIDE TO CDLDRIVERS THEY INTERACT WITH DURING COURT APPEARANCES

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD TO THE MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION MOTOR VEHICLE ADMINISTRATION IS TO HIRE AN EQUIVALENT OF 12 DRIVER LICENSING AGENTS WHO WILL WORK 20 HOURS A WEEK FOR FOUR YEARS TO HELP REDUCE THE SKILL TESTING WAIT TIMES AND DEVELOP AN ONLINE PRACTICE TEST FOR CDL APPLICANTS

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE NEW YORK STATE DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR VEHICLES TO HIRE 12 SENIOR MOTOR VEHICLE LICENSE EXAMINERS  MVLES  TO ENSURE THAT THIRD PARTY EXAMINERS ARE COMPLYING WITH TESTING STANDARDS  HIRE 36 ADDITIONAL STATE EXAMINERS TO CONTINUE SUPPORTING SKILLS TESTING  ESTABLISH A STATE POINTER EXCHANGE SEIVICES  SPEXS  HELPDESK BUSINESS UNIT FOR IMMEDIATE RESOLUTION OF DUPLICATE POINTERS  AND DEVELOP AN ONLINE CDL LICENSING RENEWAL PROCESS TO REDUCE IN PERSON TRANSACTIONS

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE RHODE ISLAND DIVISION OF MOTOR VEHICLES  RI DMV  TO AUTOMATE THE RECORDS CHECK OF IN STATE LICENSE HISTORY AND VIOLATIONS DURING THE PERMITTING AND LICENSING PROCESS  AUTOMATE THE POSTING OF MEDICAL CERTIFICATES, MEDICAL VARIANCES, AND SKILLS PERFORMANCE EVALUATIONS DIRECTLY TO THE STATE SYSTEM  AND IMPLEMENT TWO COMMERCIAL SKILLS TEST INFORMATION MANAGEMENT SYSTEM WEB SERVICES  THE TEST RESULT SERVICE AND APPLICANT SEARCH SERVICES

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR VEHICLES  CT DMV  TO ENHANCE AND INTEGRATE THE CT DMV S ONLINE MEDICAL CERTIFICATE  MEC  PORTAL DATA INTO ONE ENTERPRISE PLATFORM  AUTOMATE THE NEGATE PROCESS FOR CONVICTIONSTO IMPROVE THE TIMELINESS AND ACCURACY OF POSTING TO THE DRIVER HISTORY RECORD AND OR TRANSMITTING ELECTRONICALLY THROUGH COMMERCIAL DRIVER S LICENSE INFORMATION SYSTEM  INTEGRATE WORKFLOWS BETWEEN THE COMMERCIAL SKILLS TEST INFORMATION SYSTEM  CS TIMS  AND THE TRAINING PROVIDER REGISTRY TO IMPLEMENT THE TEST RESULTS SERVICE  TRS  AND THE CSTIMS TABLET WEBSERVICE  AND ENHANCE AND EXPAND THE CT DMV ENTERPRISE PLATFORM TO INCLUDE AN INTEGRATED APPOINTMENT MODULE FOR KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS TESTS

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE PENN DOT SAFETY ADMINISTRATION TO DEVELOP AND DEPLOY SYSTEM CHANGES TO IMPLEMENT THE DRUG AND ALCOHOL CLEARINGHOUSE  DACH  II FINAL RULE  MAKE CHANGES TO THE PENNDOT SYSTEM TO INTERFACE WITH THE NATIONAL REGISTRY TO ACCEPT MEDICAL CERTIFICATES AND POST TO DRIVER RECORDS  PERFORM MAINTENANCE AT SKILLS TESTING PAD LOCATIONS TO INCLUDE SEALING, PATCHING, REPAVING AND LINE PAINTING AT STATE OWNED FACILITIES  AND PROVIDE SAFETY CONES FOR ALL SKILLS TESTING FACILITIES

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF MOTOR VEHICLE ADMINISTRATORS TO CREATE A SHORT TRAINING CURRICULUM, INCLUDING A VIDEO AND REFERENCE MATERIALS, FOR THE FRONTLINE CUSTOMER SERVICE REPRESENTATIVE AT THE SDLAS TO DETECT AND REPORT SUSPECTED HUMAN TRAFFICKING AND PRODUCE A BRIEF INFORMATIONAL VIDEO FOR CDL APPLICANTS AND HOLDERS ON LICENSING SANCTIONS FOR DRIVERS CONVICTED OF SEVERE FORMS OF HUMAN TRAFFICKING IN A COMMERCIAL MOTOR VEHICLE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF MOTOR VEHICLE ADMINISTRATORS TO EXECUTE THE CD31 PROCESS FOR SDLAS AT LEAST ONCE EVERY 12 MONTHS

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE INDIANA SUPREME COURT   OFFICE OF COURT TECHNOLOGY TO INCREASE UNIFORMITY IN THE WAY CDL DATA IS COLLECTED DURING ALL TRAFFIC STOPSAND UPLOADED TO THE ELECTRONIC CITATION AND WARNING SYSTEM CENTRAL DEPOSITORY AND CONTINUE THE E FILING OF TRAFFIC RELATED OFFENSES, CONVICTIONS, WITHDRAWALS, AND SUSPENSIONS

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY, OFFICE OF MOTOR VEHICLES TO IMPLEMENT INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY  11  UPGRADES AND DEVELOP TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS FOR THE DRUG AND ALCOHOL CLEARINGHOUSE  DACH  II RULE ANDTHE NATIONAL REGISTER OF CERTIFIED MEDICAL EXAMINERS INTEGRATION RULE  CORRECT FINDINGS IDENTIFIED DURING THE ANNUAL PROGRAM REVIEW  IMPLEMENT IT CHANGES TO IMPROVE CDL TIMELINESS AND DATA QUALITY  AND CONTINUE GENERAL OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF CDL OPERATIONS

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA, DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY, DRIVER LICENSING PROGRAM TO IMPROVE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THE SOUTH DAKOTA CDL PROGRAM AND REDUCE CDL PROGRAMMING ISSUES THAT MAY ARISE WITH THE AUTOMATION OF THE AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF MOTOR VEHICLE ADMINISTRATORS  STATE POINTER EXCHANGE SERVICES DRIVER HISTORY RECORD SOLUTION THAT WILL BRING COMPLIANCE WITH THE EXCLUSIVE ELECTRONIC EXCHANGE OF CONVICTIONS AND WITHDRAWALS

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD TO THE AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF MOTOR VEHICLE ADMINISTRATORS IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO CONTINUE TO DELIVER TOOLS TO THE STATE DRIVERS LICENSING AGENCIES  SDLAS  BY GENERATING AND DISTRIBUTING STANDARD COMMERCIAL DRIVER S LICENSE INFORMATION SYSTEM  CDLIS  REPORTS AND TRACKING THEIR PERFORMANCE  AAMVA WILL REVIEW AND ANALYZE AT LEAST 12 SDLA S CDLIS REPORTS AND PROVIDE NEEDED ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING TO THOSE SDLAS  ENHANCE EXISTING CDLIS REPORTS AND PROVIDE NEW CDLIS REPORTS AS SDLAS EVOLVE  AND COMPLETE AT LEAST FIVE BACKLOGGED ITEMS IDENTIFIED BY THE CDLIS REPORTING SUBCOMMITTEE

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE OREGON DRIVER AND MOTOR VEHICLE SERVICES TO IMPROVE THE TIMELINESS OF REPORTING OUT OF STATE CONVICTIONS  IMPLEMENT AN OUTREACH PROGRAM FOR OREGON COURTS ON THE MASKING PROHIBITION  AND CONDUCT AN ANALYSIS OF SYSTEM FUNCTIONALITY, PROCESSES, AND PROCEDURES

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF MOTOR VEHICLE ADMINISTRATORS TO MAINTAIN THE COMMERCIAL SKILLS TESTING INFORMATION MANAGEMENT SYSTEM  CSTIMS  AND REPORT OUT OF STATE TEST RESULTS  ROOS TR  INFRASTRUCTURE  CONDUCT ENGINEERING AND OR ENHANCEMENTS TO THE NEXT GEN  NG  APPLICATION  AND PERFORM CONTINUOUS SECURITY MONITORING AND CONDUCT SECURITY ASSESSMENT OF THE CSTIMS AND ROOS TR SYSTEMS TO FULFILL THE FEDERAL INFORMATION SECURITY MANAGEMENT ACT  FISMA  REQUIREMENTS

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF MOTOR VEHICLE ADMINISTRATORS TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR UP TO 24 SDLAS THAT ARE IMPLEMENTING AN APPROVED COMMERCIAL DRIVER S LICENSE MODERNIZED SKILLS TEST SYSTEM

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD TO THE MISSOURI OFFICE OF STATE COURTS ADMINISTRATOR IS TO HIRE THREEPOSITIONS FOR OVERSIGHT, SUPPORT, AND TRAINING OF MUNICIPAL COURTS IN THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THETRAFFIC AND ORDINANCE PORTION OF THE SHOW ME COURTS TO MEET THE FEDERALLY MANDATED TIMELINES

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY TO STRENGTHEN DATA ENTRY AND CDL HELP DESK ACCESS TO CONTINUE IMPROVING TIMELINESS, ACCURACY AND COMPLETENESS OF CDL DRIVER HISTORY RECORDS  THE FUNDING WILL BE USED TO HIRE SEVEN STATE PERSONNEL AND ONE PART TIME CONTRACTOR FOR THE HELP DESK  COMPLETE IT PROGRAMMING FOR THE ENTRY LEVEL DRIVER TRAINING  ELD1  INTERFACE, MASTER POINTER RECORD NIGHTLY SYNCHRONIZATION WITH AAMV A, AND GENERAL CDL SYSTEM PROGRAMMING UPGRADES  AND STRENGTHEN THE CDL PROGRAM CONTROL BY PROVIDING CERTIFIED COMMERCIAL EXAMINER TRAINING AND INCREASING THE NUMBER OF OVERT AND COVERT SKILLS TESTING AUDITS AND MONITORING EVENTS TO PREVENT FRAUDULENT EVENTS OR ACTIVITIES

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF MOTOR VEHICLE ADMINISTRATORS TO ALLOW ACCESS FOR STATE AND LAW ENFORCEMENT PERSONNEL TO QUERY THE COMMERCIAL DRIVER S LICENSE INFORMATION SYSTEM

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE NEW JERSEY MOTOR VEHICLE COMMISSION  NJMVC  TO PROCESS AND POST COMMERCIAL DRIVER S LICENSE  CDL  DRIVER S SELF CERTIFICATION AND MEDICAL EXAMINER S CERTIFICATES  MEC  TO DRIVER HISTORY RECORDS WITHIN 10 DAYS OF RECEIPT  ANALYZE THE CURRENT MEC APPLICATION AND DATABASE TO DEVELOP A MODERNIZED REDESIGNED SYSTEM  EXPAND THE CDL MOBILE COMPLIANCE UNIT  MCU  WITH FIVE ADDITIONAL SPECIALISTS TO REDUCE SKILLS TESTING DELAYS WHILE ENSURING ALL SKILLS EXAMINERS ARE PROPERLY TRAINED  DEPLOY OFF SITE KNOWLEDGE TESTING  AND CONTINUE TO SUPPORT THE CDL ANTI FRAUD PROJECT, WHICH USES MULTI STATE FACIAL RECOGNITION TECHNOLOGY

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF MOTOR VEHICLE ADMINISTRATORS TO HOST FOUR COMMERCIAL DRIVER S LICENSE TRAIN THE TRAINER COURSES ON THE SKILLS TESTING MODEL, SO THAT SDLAS CAN TRAIN THEIR STATE AND THIRD PARTY EXAMINERS ON ADMINISTERING THE SKILLS TESTING

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE COMMERCIAL VEHICLE SAFETY ALLIANCE CVSA  TO SUPPORT THE NATIONAL CDL PROGRAM BY PROVIDING TAILORED TRAINING AND EDUCATION THROUGH IN PERSON EVENTS AND ONLINE CONTENT THROUGH CVSA LEAMING

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD TO THE EXECUTIVE OFFICE OF THE COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKY IS TO EXPAND AND ENHANCE THE KENTUCKY CDL ADVISORY COMMITTEE S INITIATIVES TO CONTINUE IMPROVING CDL DATA  HIRE CDL TRAINERS AND DEVELOP CDL TRAINING MATERIAL TO BE UTILIZED IN STAKEHOLDER TRAINING AND OUTREACH SESSIONS  AND REDUCE WAIT TIMES FOR CDL SKILLS TESTING APPLICANTS BY 25  AND TO ALLOW FOR RETESTS WITHIN 5 DAYS OF MAKING REQUEST

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE WYOMING DEPARTMENT OFTRANSPORTATION TO IMPLEMENT THE FOLLOWING THREE RULEMAKINGS  EXCLUSIVE ELECTRONIC EXCHANGE  EEE , DRUG AND ALCOHOL CLEARINGHOUSE II, AND NATIONAL REGISTRY II

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE STATE OF TENNESSEE FOR TRAVEL EXPENSES FOR 10 PROGRAM MONITORING POSITIONS WHO WILL TRAIN CDL SKILLS TEST EXAMINERS ON THE ENTRY LEVEL DRIVER TRAINING  ELD1  REQUIREMENTS  AND PROVIDE TRAINING SUPPLIES FOR THE CDL EXAMINER REFRESH COURSES THAT ARE REQUIRED

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE NORTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION, DIVISION OF MOTOR VEHICLES TO IMPLEMENT A NEW TECHNICAL SOLUTION, UNIFIED NETWORK INTERFACE  UNI  WINDOWS, WHICH REPLACES THE UNI MAINFRAME MESSAGE INTERFACE AND IMPLEMENT IT CHANGES TO COMPLY WITH THE EXCLUSIVE ELECTRONIC EXCHANGE  EEE  FINAL RULE BY AUGUST 2024

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE WEST VIRGINIA DIVISION OF MOTOR VEHICLES TO PROCURE 45 SKILLS TESTING TABLETS WITH ACCESSORIES TO REPLACE THE UNITS THAT WERE PURCHASED IN 2016 AND TO PROCURE 25 DEAF AND HARD OF HEARING COMMUNICATION DEVICES FOREACH REGIONAL OFFICE TO ALLOW EXAMINERS TO COMMUNICATE WITH THOSE DEAF AND HARD OF HEARING COMMERCIAL DRIVER S LICENSE APPLICANTS
THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE STATE OF OHIO TO CONDUCT COVERT MONITORING AT 17 CDL SKILLS TESTING LOCATIONS TWICE OVER FOUR YEARS TO ENSURE CONSISTENCY AND COMPLIANCE

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF HIGHWAY SAFETY AND  MOTOR VEHICLES TO CONDUCT SPECIAL OPERATIONS  TRAVELING TO SPECIFIED LOCATIONS  FOR FOUR YEARS ON THIRD PARTY EXAMINERS AND CONDUCT ANNUAL EDUCATION AND OUTREACH SESSIONS FOR STAKEHOLDERS AND STAFF
